senses.sense_definition: The essence or inherent nature of a person or thing.

examples.text: The artist tried to capture the essential <w>quiddity</w> of the landscape in her painting.
Philosophers have long debated the <w>quiddity</w> of human existence and what defines reality.

senses.sense_definition: An eccentricity or odd feature of behavior.

examples.text: One <w>quiddity</w> of his personality is that he always wears a hat indoors.
She loved him despite every strange <w>quiddity</w> and habit he possessed.

senses.sense_definition: A trifling point, subtle distinction, or quibble.

examples.text: The lawyer confused the jury with legal <w>quiddities</w> rather than focusing on the facts.
We should not waste time on mere <w>quiddities</w> when there are serious issues to discuss.
